revised_title: Marine Biology of Southern Cold Temperature Zones: A Focus on South Africa
tldr: The article discusses the unique marine life and ecosystems found in the southern cold temperate zones, particularly in South Africa. It highlights the high proportion of endemic species and the distinctive communities of plants and animals found in these regions. The author also explores the potential connections between the Antarctic fauna and other southern regions, as well as the factors influencing the distribution and migration of marine species in these areas.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
